column1: skyphoi 128971337508 "2015-09-13 04:59:58 GMT" http://skyphoi.tumblr.com/post/128971337508/dear-fat-people-comedian-loses-job-over-fat "shannonontheorange:  stuckinthiscocoon:  Content Warning: ableist language
column2: Â  Canadian comedian/actress Nicole Arbour is having a very interesting week. First
column3: sheposted the now-infamous YouTube video â€œDear Fat People
column4: â€ in which she attempted to use humor to convince fat people that they should lose weight â€” fellow vlogger Meghan Tonjes dubbed it â€œFat Shaming.â€ A few days later
column5: â€œFat Peopleâ€ was taken down and Arbour claimed â€œcensorship.â€ Now
column6: as â€œFat Peopleâ€ crosses the vaunted 3 million views threshold
column7: Arbour is being fired from a movie job because her director is outraged over the video he calls â€œcruel and lame.â€Â  â€œ[Iâ€™m making] a dance movie
column8: so obviously we needed a choreographer. We met with a woman who not only did traditional dance choreography
column9: but was a cheerleader as well. She was fun and nice and had a lot of energy
column10: â€ explains director Pat Mills in a statement to Zap2it. â€œâ€˜[Arbour told me she] had a YouTube channel and identified as a â€˜YouTuber.â€™ She seemed like a perfect fit for the project. I shared the script with her. She said she dug it and was excited to come on board.â€ â€œI was supposed to get together with her this week for what she called a â€˜choreo partyâ€™ to watch my favorite dance scenes and talk ideas
column12: the director of 2014â€™s â€œGuidance.â€ â€œAnd then a crazy thing happened on Saturday â€” I saw something on the Internet that made me never want to see her again.â€Â  As it turns out
column13: Arbourâ€™s video runs contrary to many of the things Mills hopes to achieve with â€œDonâ€™t Talk to Irene
column14: â€ the film she was slated to work on when it begins filming next month. â€œItâ€™s a body-positive teen dance movie set in a retirement home
column15: â€ Mills says of the plot. â€œItâ€™s about a 16-year-old girl who dreams of being a cheerleader
column16: but she is constantly bullied for being fat. She learns that she doesnâ€™t have to change anything about herself to be awesome because she already is.â€ According to the filmmaker
column17: Arbourâ€™s video really hit home. â€œIâ€™m gay. I was bullied a lot as a kid
column18: â€ he reasons. â€œI am no stranger to ridicule and loneliness.â€ â€œ[â€˜Dear Fat Peopleâ€™] is an unfunny and cruel fat-shaming video that guises itself about being about â€˜healthâ€™
column19: â€ Mills says of the clip. â€œItâ€™s fat phobic and awful. It went on for over for six minutes. I felt like I had been punched in the gut. I was so upset I was shaking like Shelley DuVall in the â€˜The Shiningâ€™.â€Â  â€œBullies like Nicole Arbour are the reason I am making this movie
column20: â€ he says. â€œIâ€™m tired of body shaming. Itâ€™s everywhere.â€ This latest development raises an interesting question. A self-professed comedian/actress like Arbour clearly operates her YouTube channel for self-promotion
column21: and posting a vid like â€œDear Fat Peopleâ€ aims at courting controversy (she even begins the clip with a mocking â€œArgh! Some people are already mad at this video!â€) that falls in line with the old adage â€œThereâ€™s no such thing as bad publicity.â€ But what good is 3 million views if it gets you fired from the job you aspire to? â€œItâ€™s very odd that we live in a world now where people post their opinions on YouTube (to get views)
column22: but they cannot say these opinions to our faces
column23: â€ says Mills. â€œMy film celebrates being different. It celebrates not fitting in. I want to arm teen girls of all sizes with confidence. People like Nicole Arbour strip this confidence away.â€ At the end of his statement
column24: Mills directs the YouTuber directly: â€œNicole: Did you even read my script? It is a body positive teen movie. It has a message that is in direct opposition to your cruel and lame YouTube rant
column25: â€ he says. â€œWe will not be working together. You are not hired for â€˜Donâ€™t Talk to Ireneâ€™.â€Â   good get this trash can out of here omg.  shannonontheorange: stuckinthiscocoon:  Content Warning: ableist language
